subject: Negotiation
title: Blockbuster Laughs at Netflix
description: A micro-lesson that makes Blockbuster Laughs at Netflix usable.

hook.text: In 2000, Netflix offered to sell itself to Blockbuster for $50 million. Blockbuster's CEO laughed them out of the room.

buildup.text: Netflix was a tiny DVD-by-mail startup bleeding cash. Blockbuster had 9,000 stores and $6 billion in revenue.

discovery.text: Blockbuster's CEO thought streaming was a fad and physical stores were unbeatable.

twist.text: Blockbuster filed for bankruptcy in 2010. Netflix is now worth over $250 billion.

climax.text: Dismissing a weak opponent's offer because you feel invincible is a fatal negotiation mistake.

punchline.text: The deal you laugh at today might bury you tomorrow.

quiz.question: What fundamental mistake did Blockbuster make?
options: They dismissed a disruptive competitor because they felt invincible
Netflix tricked them into a bad deal
